fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.examples.hioa_with_vh

Class HIOA_Generator

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
        • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.AtomicHIOA
          • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.examples.hioa_with_vh.HIOA_Generator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VariableDefinitionsAndSharingI, VariableInitialisationI, AtomicModelI, EventsExchangingI, ModelI, java.io.Serializable

    @ModelExternalEvents(imported=TicEvent.class)
 @ModelExportedVariable(name="generated",
                       type=java.lang.Double.class)
public class HIOA_Generator
extends AtomicHIOA
    The class HIOA_Counter implements a simple real time HIOA atomic model that receives an external event TicEvent and counts them in an exported variable generated.

    Description

    The exported variable generated can use a value history. This is controlled by the value of the static variable SimulationMain.WITH_VALUE_HISTORY. If this variable is true, then a value history is used with a linear inter/extrapolation scheme for the evaluation of the variable generated, otherwise no value history is used (and then the evaluation of the variable generated returns simply the latest computed value).

    • Imported events: TicEvent
    • Exported events: none
    • Imported variables: none
    • Exported variables: name = generated, type = Double

    Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2020-11-24

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • output

        public java.util.ArrayList<EventI> output()
        Description copied from interface: AtomicModelI
        maps the current internal state to the output set; this method is user-model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models.

        Description

        Beware that when this method is called, though the simulation time has conceptually reached the time if the next internal event, the value returned by getCurrentStateTime has not yet been updated to that time. Hence the actual current simulation time is given by this.getCurrentStateTime().add(this.getNextTimeAdvance()).

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     getNextTimeAdvance().lessThan(Duration.INFINITY)
 pre     getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getCurrentStateTime()))
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Returns:
        the corresponding external events or null if none.
        See Also:
        AtomicModelI.output()

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Returns:

      • userDefinedInternalTransition

        public void userDefinedInternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        perform an internal transition; this method is user model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.

        Description

        The current simulation time when this method is called can be accessed by calling the method getCurrentStateTime.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     getCurrentStateTime().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent())
 pre     elapsedTime != null
 pre     elapsedTime.lessThan(Duration.INFINITY)
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        userDefinedInternalTransition in interface ModelI
        Overrides:
        userDefinedInternalTransition in class AtomicModel
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - time since the last event.
        See Also:
        AtomicModel.userDefinedInternalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)

      • userDefinedExternalTransition

        public void userDefinedExternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        do an external transition using a previously stored external input event; this method is user-model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.

        Description

        The current simulation time when this method is called can be accessed by calling the method getCurrentStateTime.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     elapsedTime != null
 pre     elapsedTime.lessThanOrEqual(getNextTimeAdvance())
 pre     getCurrentStateTime().lessThanOrEqual(getTimeOfNextEvent())
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        userDefinedExternalTransition in interface ModelI
        Overrides:
        userDefinedExternalTransition in class AtomicModel
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - simulation time since the last processed event.
        See Also:
        AtomicModel.userDefinedExternalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)
